content.question: An object is subject to multiple forces that result in the object having horizontal and vertical velocity components <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math>, respectively as a function of time, as shown. Which of the following free-body diagrams could represent the forces exerted on the object?

choices.label: The figure shows a force diagram and a graph. The force diagram shows two equally sized arrows extending from a common point. One arrow moves vertically upward three units, and the other arrow moves vertically downward three units. The graph has a horizontal axis labeled positive x, and a vertical axis labeled positive y.

The figure shows a force diagram and a graph. The force diagram shows two arrows extending from a common point. One arrow moves upward three units and to the right two units, and the other arrow moves vertically downward three units. The graph has a horizontal axis labeled positive x, and a vertical axis labeled positive y.

The figure shows a force diagram and a graph. The force diagram shows three arrows extending from a common point. One arrow moves upward three units and to the right two units, the second arrow moves vertically downward three units, and the third arrow moves horizontally to the left two units. The graph has a horizontal axis labeled positive x, and a vertical axis labeled positive y.

The figure shows a force diagram and a graph. The force diagram shows three arrows extending from a common point. One arrow moves vertically upward three units, the second arrow moves horizontally to the right two units, and the third arrow moves downward four units and to the left two units. The graph has a horizontal axis labeled positive x, and a vertical axis labeled positive y.

content.answer: The figure shows a force diagram and a graph. The force diagram shows three arrows extending from a common point. One arrow moves vertically upward three units, the second arrow moves horizontally to the right two units, and the third arrow moves downward four units and to the left two units. The graph has a horizontal axis labeled positive x, and a vertical axis labeled positive y.
